Reviews.Title: “Art Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hee_Sung_K
Reviews.Content: mordern facilities' hotel with inconvenient hotel access.. but got an award as a art hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hip hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: antonyang
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quirky yet comfy, the staff helpful but not overwhelming. The hotel is just a stone throw away from the river, where you can walk to Clarke Quay and enjoy the food and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: FaisalAhmad
Reviews.Content: Gallery Hotel is pretty unique from the way it has been built. Location and surrounding of the hotel is one of the best. Its located in between Mohd Sultan road and the river side. On weekends one can enjoy the happening crowd on the riverside and have different cuisines after which take a long riverside walk till the hotel. Name any cuisine and its their on the revier side. Hotel as i mentioned is pretty unique in every sense, starting from hopping lifts to rooms numbers written on the wooden floors. Room size is average but almost fully loaded with all facilities. I stayed there for two weeks on a business trip and found the property pretty good. It has a decent Gym and Swimming pool to relax. Most liked the concept of having tables with alloy wheels and glass top pretty unique. Restaurant is not too big but food is good with a nice band playing at the prime time.

Reviews.Title: “easy and young”
Reviews.Author: RobertoGiulio14023
Reviews.Content: Not such a "design" :built 10 years ago, but still confortable. Room are big enough and contemporary. At least it is not the usual standard hotel, but design should also mean clever ideas while not so clever is the way room numbers are written out of the room, you might not find it. One issue is that the buttons for the lights and the alarm clock are integrated into the head board of the bed. In the night you see a non stop red light glare from the clock. A few little more little technical mistakes will not ruin anyway your stay. May be it is worthy to try the panoramic swimming pool and problably not the restaurant at 4th floor, but you are on riverside and there is a lot of choice for drinking and eating. Wi Fi is free and working well, well done ! Taxi parking outside in case of need. This was my second stay. Not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel in the Quay side location”
Reviews.Author: warllen
Reviews.Content: A chic hotel located in the Quay side of Singapore river, where surrounded by the fine resturants and bars, easy access to China town, and walk distance to the Clarke Quay MTR station. Room space fairly big compares to other Singapore hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but nice, mainly location.”
Reviews.Author: Looknfeel
Reviews.Content: The hunger to see more experience more made find look for and try some place with a different feel. The website of the hotel showed and showcased it well enough to generate interest for a user looking for a "away from regular" hotel feel. Interesting hotel nice with a "different feel" guess has become dated so beginning to look a little out of style in finishes and interior looks. having said all that , it still is has good feel and a a uniqueness of its own. the pool area, the elevator approach create a different experience. staff is friendly, and helpful and it matters. The winner all the way is the LOCATION, what a nice serene calm amazing location with all the eateries and walks around the river front can walk all the up to clarks quay/ boat quay and all for a nice evening , and depending on what you like can choose from a large variety. morning breakfasts would be nice r on river front , so even if the hotel has to offer complimentary breakfast , please do try riverfront. over all decent comfortable no nonsense hotel with amazing surroundings. cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average hotel, but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LennyV39
Reviews.Content: My fourth stay in this rather average hotel in terms of comfort, design, and friendliness. Its location on the Singapore river, however, makes up for everything. Nice breezy terasses and a great choice of restaurants are literally on the doorstep. Quality of breakfast buffet and roomservice dishes are not meeting 4 star standards.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: VintageMilgauss
Reviews.Content: I found my recent two night stay very satisfying. The room was comfortable, clean, and the hotel has great facilities ( pool and gym). It is also in an unbeatable location near the center of Singapore, with most places a 15min cab ride away. Judging by the extremes of feedback, it is clear that this place can be polarizing. This would be an excellent hotel for solo and couples, but may not be the best for ppl staying with a large family group.

Reviews.Title: “Poor example of what Singapore hotels are like”
Reviews.Author: Chamayou
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for 3 ( my mother, my sister and myself ) and were given a twin bedded room with a camp bed . There was no room to get in or out of the 3rd bed. The room was totally inadequate and when we asked to be moved we were told all the rooms in Singapore hotels were like that and if not happy to contact our travel advisor. The staff on duty were not at all helpful or friendly. The room was not clean and looked dated and shabby. There was a small wardrobe and no dressing table. The bathroom was dirty, the hairdryer did not work.. At breakfast we found several dirty plates. We decided to check out and found a delightful hotel with large rooms and 3 full size beds, friendly and helpful staff who were distressed that we had been so unhelpfully treated. I really could not recommend The Gallery Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, with more atmosphere than most.”
Reviews.Author: AnskyWinslow
Reviews.Content: Gallery hotel has an interesting atmosphere with quirky art throughout and an unusual layout. You have to take 2 separate lifts to reach your floor; level 4 is the change point and is where the restaurant & 'lounge' are located. Some of the floors look tired/dated. Our executive room on L8 was a good size, nicely decorated, with partial river view & nightclub style black marble bathroom! Reception areas absolutely freezing. Nightclub v popular with the locals but didn't disturb us.

Reviews.Title: “I really like it.”
Reviews.Author: Vuvie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Decent room. Decent size. Everything is clean and works well. Nothing bad to say at all. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay despite some negative reviews here”
Reviews.Author: Merkey
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking for a 3 night stay and despite the many negative reviews here, we actually had a decent stay. The reception staff were friendly and put us on the 10th floor (highest floor) after hearing from other Tripadvisor reviewers that there can be a lot of noise from a nightclub nearby. We had no such problems - but also the jazz club was shut and the karaoke bar was also closed during our stay. Our room was nice and clean - not the newest room/furnishings but clean and we had everything we needed. One thing I did notice was there were a lot of sharp edges everywhere and this might not be good if you travel with young children. It was perfectly fine for us, nothing to write home about and really not shabby at all so maybe we were lucky? The pool area was nice and refreshing but quiet during our stay. There is something weird about the way you get to the hotel rooms via lift: you have to go to the 4th floor and switch lifts. This is a bit of a hassle but not the greatest problem in the grand scheme of things. The hotel had free wired internet and stored our luggage for 12 hours before our very late night flight. The good thing about staying here is that you are within walking distance of a lot of restaurants and bars in Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay. I would recommend this hotel for a young couple who prefers to travel independently. Tip: the Japanese yakitori restaurant in the same building is excellent but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need a refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel. Was very happy with our first stay a year ago, the rooms were clean, chic and our only gripe was that we had to change three elevators just to get to our room (still the same). This second stay, our room was shabby and tired-looking. The windows and bathroom had oily handprints all over, while our towels were a dirty grey in colour. A big disappointment, especially since we chose to stay at this hotel with our newborn baby based on our first experience. Service was also decidedly cool, aside from the friendly concierge team. For the S$300 we paid to stay, it was definitely not worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but starting to show wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: joannetopia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel twice and while there's little to fault, there's also little to shout about. The hotel is starting to show some wear and tear and could do with a face lift. First, the colour scheme. For some reason, some designer thought it'd be a good idea to make everything purple, blue, pink and green. You'd see the same 4 colours everywhere - from the breakfast area, down to the cushions in your room. And the pillows are starting to look a bit old. Everything in the room is clean and very safe to use. But like a favourite towel at home, some of the towels are starting to fray and get a little thin. The room is on the smaller side, but since Gallery Hotel is billed as a boutique hotel, that's to be expected. There's room for a bed, a table, the closet and little else. TV is a flat screen, high-def viariety, so much appreciated. Plugged in my Nintendo Wii and it worked just fine. The hotel may not be in the best of location, certainly getting out of the area would require a walk to Clark Quay mrt station (a pleasant enough walk when it's not too hot or raining), a bus or a quick cab ride. But there are plenty of food options around the Robertson Quay area if that's what you're looking for. Liang Court Shopping Centre is also within walking distance should you require the amenities of a shopping centre or a supermarket (the Japanese supermarket Meidiya is a great place to pick up Japanese groceries or get a quick bite from the many small eateries within it). Gallery Hotel is a decent place for the price you're paying, especially when hotel prices in Singapore are going up, up, up. If you do not intend to splash out too much for a hotel room (i.e. less than $250 a night), do not want to stay at a budget hotel (even those are going for $150), and are ok with not being in the city area, this may be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and If you take your car the complimentary parking is really useful as there s no where to park in sg!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_ECP
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit small, but location wise it was brilliant. Other plus points friendly staff , great pool and Free wifi was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ntrats
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December 2010. In my opinion, everything was standard. Standard service, standard quality of breakfast buffet, and standard room. The receptionist service was somewhat cold, so did the service in the breakfast buffet. Few choices for the breakfast buffet. Some electric buttons in my room are broken (the digital clock).

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: vikramyadav2011
Reviews.Content: It's been a very good experience. A warm welcome and everything is well managed.Food was very good and been a vegetarian , options were available. room was well cleaned and all the necessary aminities are lined up. I advised to visit there and feel the worth paying.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Ann W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gallery Hotel for five nights in July 2011. The room was very comfortable and the breakfasts good and varied. However, it was the additional service that stunned me. A friend with whom I was travelling had a bad accident while in China Town and had to be hospitalised. Not only did the hotel send fruit and flowers, but the manager visited her personally. Their level of compassion and going over and above the call of duty was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: smoregate
Reviews.Content: Thump thump thump thump of music from the night club is all you can hear in the room. The hotel needs to decide what it is on business for.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want sleep”
Reviews.Author: overit_15
Reviews.Content: The Gallery Hotel has a nightclub under it that they have no control over. You will hear screaming teenagers, smashed bottles and revving cars all night. No amount of calling reception will help. I recommend staying over the other side of the river if you want to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Steph1979
Reviews.Content: Worst night’s sleep I have ever experienced in a hotel. We were kept awake until 4am by the music coming from the night club below our window. All you could hear was the deep bass going through your whole body. Even ear plugs didn't work. Called the reception and they gave the typical response "Sorry but we don't operate the nightclub. You will have to contact its manager". Obviously they value the night club more than their guests comfort. Needless to say we were both extremely grumpy and still are extremely grumpy for this experience. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in Gallery Hotel for my travel to Singapore. The hotel is not that bad as commented by other reviewers but I agree that the quality of the services provided is degrading. If it is your first time in traveling to Singapore, this hotel may not be a good choice for you as it is not close to any MRT station. Nevertheless, you can walk through a bridge and there is a bus stop nearby, or you can walk along the Singapore River for about 10-15 minutes to Clarke Quay MRT Station. There are lots of good restaurants and bars in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - bad service”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyz4
Reviews.Content: Wanted a quick getaway / stayaction without the hassle of traveling overseas. So I choose to stay at Gallery hotel due to the fact that it's located at a very good area with alot of good places for dinner & drinks. And also the affordable online rates. The reasons why we were very disappointed with the hotel : 1) Beds We booked through Agoda site which didn't state if it was going to be a twin or double bed. When we checked in, we were told that they only allowed twin-beds if we booked online. (which obviously we did) The hotel was full and we were recommended to upgrade to a Junior Suite for S$130 (without taxes) 2) Free breakfast & mini bar (not!) : Once we decided to upgrade, they told us that we had free complimentary breakfast & mini bar drinks. We were quite happy about it but they did not give us any vouchers to confirm this. We decided to check in first & double confirm with the officer before we headed out in the evening. We spoke to the guest officer who's name is April. She was not very friendly and insist that her colleague made a mistake and we DEFINITELY DID NOT have a complimentary breakfast/mini bar drinks. There were no apologies or explanation. Just the fact that her colleague made a mistake. But she assured us that she will check with him (as he is on his break and was not around) We headed out and came back.. but was still feeling exhausted by checking YET again at the counter for this "miscommunication" --> Please note that they DID NOT even bother to get back to us on this issue. 3) Room Service As for the room service,When I wanted to order beer, they told me they didnt serve by pint. But in the end, they served a full pint (to my room) --> This made us more confused as they insisted that they didnt have it! Upon checking out, we discovered that there was DEFINITELY a free complimentary breakfast/mini bar! Very Very disappointed by this hotel & will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay for this price”
Reviews.Author: DreamBasket
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient and the rooms are a relatively good size, however that's pretty much where the positives stop for me. This may have been a "designer" hotel when built, but now it's looking very tired, i.e. the hallway carpets need replacing, the main dining room looks dated, etc. The service is also lackluster, i.e. no doorman at the front entrance and room service trays with leftover food left in hallways overnight. However, it's the odd design choices that really bugged me. Number one design crime: the LED alarm display built into the bedhead. You cannot turn this thing off meaning that you have a red light at eye level on for the whole night. Why would anyone think this is a sensible design? I rang Reception and asked if this could be fixed. Humorously, a hotel worker appeared with a piece of cardboard and sticky tape to temporarily cover it!! It's an incredibly stupid design decision and does not work practically at all. Additionally, the bathroom is tiny with a large and potentially dangerous inward swinging glass door. And all TV stations did not work. Even more annoyingly, the walls are paper thin. We heard our noisy drunken neighbours on one side come home talking loudly at 1am. And the next morning, we could hear our other neighbours' alarm going off at 5am. Not ideal when we didn't need to be up until 7am. As I said, the location is good, but there are better options in Singapore at this price point. I would only stay here again if I could get an exceptionally good discount deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: travellati
Reviews.Content: Location is awesome - walking distance to CLARKE QUAY and even chinatown. Not far at all from Orchard st and sentosa so taxi rides are cheap. Service is good. The only issue we had was on arrival at 8pm our room still wasn't ready, there was staff in there doing the final sweep. And then the next day we went out in the morning and came home at 3pm and our room hadn't been cleaned i.e the daily housekeeping. This was after we had left the 'please make up room' sign on. Other than this it was a good place to stay for a short visit, 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great riverside location”
Reviews.Author: 255100Traveler
Reviews.Content: Good: Location is excellent: Just a short stroll from Clarke Quay, Robertson Quay is brimming with busy restaurants and bars nestled under the trees and along the waterfront. Not so good: Single beds in twin rooms are very narrow; rooms are not ideal for sharing with a friend as bathrooms are both tiny and offer no privacy; windows don't open; breakfast buffet is very pricey for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Strange dear, but true dear I'd never stay here by choice dear”
Reviews.Author: Michael J H
Reviews.Content: Not sure what the owners think when they review this hotel. Its quirky from a western point of view. The wi fi works best outside your room. The hardwire internet is OK in your room. The room may have been cutting edge once but now its not. Strange wardrobes and the toilet is oddly positioned in a narrow crevice and is very,very low. The bed head has an inlay panel that has red LED indicators to operate all the room lights and aircon. At night in the dark these little red glowing lights drive you nuts. They can never be all off or you have no aircon. The breakfast is so so - continually running out and the tables and set up is quirky. Place always seems busy with conferences and the like. Location is good from point of view that its easy,close and safe to walk out to a wide variety of restaurants. When we were there it took three days of consistent hassling to get the IT staff to get the internet working. They put me through the Q&A many times and were in denial. They did not know their SMTP. After 4 days without a murmur of an apology they found had their server had been hacked and their internet provider blackbanned for sending out spam. Eclectic

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great location”
Reviews.Author: TaliaMoselle
Reviews.Content: At first the hotel was very underwhelming. There is not much of a lobby and the elevator situation is strange, you have to switch elevators each time you go to your room. The rooms are a bit sparse but clean and have everything you need. View was kind of obstructed by a huge metal mesh screen over the whole side of building...I guess without it the residential area would see right in the windows though. After being not so happy with the hotel, I relaxed my expectations a bit (price isn't cheap) and enjoyed it! The service was friendly and reliable, the pool was small but lovely and empty all the time. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers or couples mostly, not for families with children. The location is excellent! Far enough from Clarke Quay (7 min walk) to escape the crazy tourist madness, Robertson Quay is quieter and sweeter. The bars outside the hotel almost replace a missing lobby, they have wifi and you can hang out there as long as you like. I recommend this hotel but don't expect anything fancy!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient; friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: rower98
Reviews.Content: Our stay was generally good considering we were out all day. The only comment I have is the food -- breakfast was nothing special. The coffee making facility in the room needs improvement; their sachet creamer was hard (perhaps expired). I tried making coffee but did not drink it before we left. When we returned in the evening, the room was made but the used cup with half-consumed coffee was not cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: abby19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for here one night after hearing good thing things about this hotel. And I was disappointed. Firstly Upon arrival, we were told there were only smoking rooms available.obviously this was not known to us prior. But Being an occasional smoker myself i didnt mind it . However for non smokers the stench that hung in the air would have been unBearable . The room that we were given was poorly maintained , no doubt it had the usual amenities that we would expect in a hotel room . Like an iron and ironing board . But it was all very tired looking. And the board had a stain. the bed was what was a complete let down. Not comfortable . Although the quilt and pillows were all right. It could have been that we got the wrong room. Because from what we heard previously , this hotel supposedly prides itself on having individually decorated rooms with an artistic twist.sadly we Felt none of that here, but to be fair the rest of the hotel seemed ok. Bottom line is -we paid SGD$348 including taxes for one night. In terms of value for money not worth it at all -tired looking room. ( maybe not the same for all rooms) -decent location -unkept looking pool Hotel next door seemed much better . Bottom line is -

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, quirky and modern!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mucaque
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 3 nights at Gallery hotel with my husband and three children. When we arrived we were given a 'smoking' room and the ninth floor smelt pretty bad so I asked for non smoking and we were moved to the 8th level for the following two nights. We enjoyed a fabulous view of Singapore river and city buildings and the pool with the glass sides was certainly unique for all!! Staff were efficient and accommodating, they organised bus rides for us the zoo and universal studios. The hotel itself had a very 'adult' feel to it so perhaps wouldn't be the choice if we were staying for extended period of time but for a few nights it was cool. Also, position of the hotel would be more suited to couples because it is in the heart of where the pub and restaurant action is, so it was very very noisy at night and if we weren't so tired we would not have slept! Loved the colourful cushions, so many hotels are just immersed in white and stainless steel and leave you feeling so sterile! Overall positive experience though.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Nightclubs but in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: ShaunDhaka
Reviews.Content: The Glasshaus Galleria is a hyper modern hotel in a quiet location but in walking distance of restaurants at the quay via the canal. The staff were very accommodating when we arrived at 06:30 a.m, and allowed us to sleep on the mezzanine until our room was ready. The rooms are quite small, ultra-modern and comfortable. The rooftop pool is amazing, as it extends from a balcony over the road, with glass sides so you can see the surroundings whilst underwater.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel with the architecture being something that was left to the imagination of a 5 year old. Its not bad, but certainly interesting. Pool was very unique with the leading edge hanging over the side of the balcony ... aquarium style so you felt like Shamu or something. Rooms were your normal studios. A little compact but nevertheless well designed interior furnishings. We've stayed here twice and they generally have different themes for different rooms which made it very unique. I saw in the reality tv show, HP Space, they had the contestants design each room as how they saw fit. Interesting ploy but it makes it unique. I love the bathroom frosted glass wall styles and overall, no complaints. Nice area if you're a tourist and not too much of a walk to Clarke Quay. It is a little out of town for business people but taxis are so well organised in Singapore and cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a decent location just outside the CBD”
Reviews.Author: The_Rottweiler
Reviews.Content: My 3rd or 4th stay at this hotel. Was able to get a good room rate which made my choice easier. Check in was a breeze, and room was a clean, comfortable and sound choice. No complaints. Air cond was nice and cold, bed was dust free and bathroom was spotless. This hotel hasn't disappointed me yet. Great Aussie fare across the road. Hotel is recommended for individuals or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and Clean”
Reviews.Author: bthoenissen
Reviews.Content: It was the second time I stay in the Gallery Hotel. It's just 5-10 minutes by feet away from Clark Quay, where you can find a lot of bars. If you're aren't looking for a party, you should have a walk a long the river, which end at the Merlion. Of course you will have a beautiful view to the Marina Bay Sand - Don't forget to bring your camera. Our room was 751 and you need to use two different elevator. The first one is open for the public (level 1 to 4), so that even non hotel guest can visit the restaurant. The second elevator is only for hotel guest and you require your key card to go up. For us the Gallery was a good choice and we will go there again if we would like to see our friends in Singapore. BTW: The Gallery offers you free WIFI at your room.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and nice”
Reviews.Author: tourismspecialist88
Reviews.Content: Spent nearly a week staying in the Gallery Hotel, and ended up enjoying it very much. Though I was booked in a standard room, on check in I requested a switch to a river view, and was given what I believe is called a "Bookend" room. It was roomy enough, and the view was very nice. Overall, the room is fine, though the bed is a bit too firm for my tastes, and a bit run down. Internet worked just fine, and all the usual things are available in the room - bathrobe, safe, minibar, etc. A nice element (at least of my stay) was that items in the minibar were complimentary. The bathroom is quite cozy and a little odd. Certainly not a highlight, but did the trick for its primary purposes. Breakfast was good, if not great. It did get a little repetitive after 5 days, but I still felt that it was a good, healthy, and pleasant breakfast overall. I didn't have any other meals in the hotel, so can't comment on that. Service was good - even to the point that the staff somehow knew that it was my birthday, and delivered a complimentary tiramisu, which was delicious. The pool is definitely unique and special - do try it out (bring goggles) - it felt pretty amazing to be swimming on the 5th floor, underwater, looking out down below to see cars driving by and birds flying around. And the deep section is just about long enough to be able to get in some decent swimming for exercise. Also, the gym is good, even though slightly longer hours and some new equipment (and maybe another treadmill or two) would make it even better. Finally, the neighborhood is great - MANY options for good eating, as has been mentioned, and also truly enjoyable to talk walks along the river, for leisure, exercise, or both. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Topert
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here a while ago. We saw a show was talking about design hotels, Gallery is one of them. It was right by the river where they have cafes, restaurants and shops along the way, which is a great walk from the hotel to down town. Hotel's check-in is fast, the room is however very average, I suppose it looks better on tv. Room is extremely small and the detail of the room seems outdated, needs a major update. Breakfast is very disappointed and very average. The hotel pool on the rooftop is on the other hand very nice. Hotel's location is good enough, why would you have a problem when you can finish the whole country by 20-30 mins? Overall the hotel is average. I am satisfied however would prob not going to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you're a foodie!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi8888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from the shopping areas but in the heart of some of the best dining with Red House, Boomerang, No Signboard Brussel Sprouts all within a stones throw away from the hotel. The hotel itself is a little dated with its attempt at being a little niche. Still the staff were nice and the rooms were pleasant. The pool was very cool with it's side made of glass so you are looking out onto the street - it's definetely worth a swim but keep in mind that it needs more sun lounges - there are only 4! Breakfast is not too flash but with loads of restaurants around it there's no lack of choice. So if you love food - it's a great place to be if you want shopping stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finendandy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a few times and it's a nice small hotel on the edge of the CBD. It's close enough to be a long walk away to the major entertainment district of Clarke Quay and yet not nearly far enough to take a cab there. With the smaller Robertson Quay next door however, there should be enough pubs and restaurants to provide choices a visitor on a short stay. Be warned though - the weekend crowds to Robertson Quay make the hotel a popular spot to park or to take taxis from - creating noise and some inconvenience on Friday and Saturday nights. Otherwise, the taxi stand outside the hotel usually has taxis waiting for fares. (There is no subway station close by). The rooms I've stayed in have usually be clean and adequately done up. However, there was one room that they put me in once that only had a shower curtain dividing the shower and the toilet, with the run-off drain located right in the middle of the toilet. This made the entire toilet a flooded area every time I took a shower. Check the toilet the first thing you do and avoid this room at all costs. I found the restaurant decent with great staff. With the food choices available in Singapore though, I would only eat in the restaurant only if I wanted to do away with the hassle of deciding which of the many good restaurants in the city to go to. The one thing that I enjoy the most every time I stay there is the swimming pool on the 5th (6th?) floor. It at the corner of the building and has full glass walls on the sides facing out. It is quite an experience swimming and being able to look down on the street below while underwater. (At the same time, people from the street can see you so naughty things while swimming!). Overall, it's a nice little hotel that is right at the edge of the action the city has to offer. A good place to stay if you're looking for something affordable yet not too far from the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “3-star level”
Reviews.Author: TandTSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Location OK: close to Singapore River, where you have a lot of restaurants, bars, cafes etc. A bit far to walk from other sightseeing spots, and also the MRT is relatively far, but OK if you are not in a hurry. Hotel is modern, trendy, design Service is relatively basic, the staff is not very friendly nor very well trained - well tipical, a design hotel that looks nice but not much clue about service...well if you get a good rate then it is OK. But do not expect great service level. Rooms: I recommend the Glasshouse Rooms, they seem to be bigger because they have more windows. Pls be aware that the rooms are all relatively small! There is not much space for your luggage. Pool: OK, but only 3 sun chairs, so might get crowded if sunny day...relatively small pool and pool area. Have not tried the restaurant in the hotel - there are many good options around so you better try these! Overall OK if you expect a 3-star level and if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malaysian-nomad
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at Gallery Hotel, and there are reasons for this. The hotel is situated at Robertson Quay, at the tip of the famous Clarke Quay stretch. The hotel prides itself as being one of the best voted hotels for many years. Hotel staff and service are top notch, though not over the top. Rooms are very chic and artistic (did I mention it's a boutique hotel?). Bathroom is a tiny bit claustrophobic, however well equipped. Best thing though is that wireless internet is free throughout the entire hotel. Breakfast at the hotel is good, except that regulars may notice that the breakfast buffet menu hardly ever changes. The only downside is that it's sometimes difficult to get a cab, as the hotel does not really face any of the main roads.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable compromise in CBD Singapore - but yes a compromise”
Reviews.Author: navin_v_agarwal
Reviews.Content: you will never run out of the Hotel stay options in Singapore in whichever location you want to stay there. But then CBD of all major business centers has been a quest for most travellers looking to fir in the tiny budgets most companies have for travel. Ofcourse this is not meant for the CEOs. They can always go to The Fullerton and pay close to a bomb. But affordable stay in right in the heart of Singapore's business district is what Gallerey has achieved. The hotel has some distinct advantages : Prominent location. Near to the singapore river and situated at the Robertson Quay. Walkable distance from the center of Singapore business. Come on we are in Singapore which is nice and clean and green. Walking is a pleasure there but for the sweat!!! Reasonably priced considering the location. Easy accessibility to LIttle India and China town. Yes We indians still want to eat authentic Indian available at Little India and shop at Mustafa's Very easy to get cab or a public transport. Ohh you have to travel to figure out that getting a cab in Singapore can be a real ardent job. Very close the center of activity in singapore like the Boat quay, pubs, the reverse bungee and ofcourse the Clark Quay. But then the affordability comes at a cost and the cost makes one think whether one wants to be staying at gallery again. (I am an exception as i went for the advantages) The hotel is just a building and everythig is packed in a single building. There is nothing worth mentioning like a lobby, a pool or a gym. From the time one enters and to the time you go to your room, you have to atleast change elevators and wait for them to change. The pool is such that if there are 4 guys in there we start bumping to each other. and the pool is easily visible from the building opposite to the road. My Indian friends will certainly not be comfortable in such situation. To go to the gym or to the spa you have to cross some 2 buildings and then realise ohh the spa closes at 8!!! and then the biggest casulty is the poor room. if you did not realise in the mornig and get up in darkness you will bump on the wall. Yes you got it. the rooms are very small. There is no internet available in the room. How is this possible in a business hotel??? Please visit once. But then I think Singapore is not the place to really have a great vacation. Full credit to the guys out there to create what they have created out of an tiny island but at the end of the day its all artificial. Singsapore is all about inclusive and great democratic culture. You feel there at home at once and when you travel for business you want to be closer to office and if that is the case like me stay at Gallerey at affordable prices. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended and it was nice for the one night we spent in Singapore. The staff are very friendly and forthcoming and will help at any time. Rooms are ok, pretty standard and do not offer any outrageously interesting things. We found the bathroom pretty pathetic, with no proper divider for the shower, hence the entire bathroom gets flooded while you have a shower. Was rather annoying as you constantly step into a wet cell if you enter the bathroom. Skipped breakfast as I opted for another location. Hotel caters well for family with kids as they were quick in brining a babycot (although we had to remind them to do so!).

Reviews.Title: “Outdated concept, a bit tired, good for flashpackers.”
Reviews.Author: etbw
Reviews.Content: The location might be convenient for Robertson and Clarke Quays but the rooms and hotel are tired and in need of an update. This may have been a concept hotel when it opened but now seems to cater to flash-packers. For the price, the rooms are a decent size but there are very few power points and the furnishings are tired.T win rooms are as standard. The cleanliness of the linen and the bathroom had to be addressed on request and the control panel that operates everything in the room is prone to issues - maintenance has to be called to turn the lights/television/do not disturb sign on and off. Some rooms are quite damp - any comments made to the staff were addressed promptly but they were not surprised - suggesting this hotel is no stranger to issues and is now aimed at top end back packers.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mark60878
Reviews.Content: I typically stay in the larger, more corporate hotels in Singapore (Sheraton, Swissotel Stamford). This was a great change of pace. Best asset is the location, a short walk to Clarke Quay, Fort Canning, etc. As others have mentioned, the MRT is a 15 minute walk, so that is a downside. But a minor one. The double elevators are odd, but I don't really mind them as they aren't that busy and thus wait times for lifts are short. Staff was great and very accommodating (early check in, late check out, etc). Definitely will stay here again on shorter trips (its hard to give up the rewards points from Starwood for the longer trips).

Reviews.Title: “My second house in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: takashison
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel almost every time when I visit Singapore. Relaxing atmosphere and environment because of its location in Robertson Quay which is also near Clark Quay.

Reviews.Title: “trendy look”
Reviews.Author: mytravelthoughts
Reviews.Content: the gallery hotel markets itself on its design features. yes they are impressive and it certainly feels very trendy. however, its not as big as many other singapore hotels. the pool is again trendy but not very big as more useful for a couple of laps. Its also not very well designed as you have to go outside past the pool to go to the gym. my room was spacious but the flashy flatscreen TV was temperamental in its operation. also, there are only a few high profile boutique designer rooms, with the others being of a more standard design. a plus point was the free internet access MACs in the restaurant area. one big negative is that you have to walk a fair distance to get to the nearest mtr station (clarke quay) - to get here you have to walk along the river. it was obvious that there were a lot of expats and tourists milling around here in the evening and if you want restaurants and bars that's fine. I personally think you can get much better in other parts on singapore and life would be so much easier if you have a closer mtr station (imagine walking in the tropical heat). for the sole reason of convenience and access, i would probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but somewhat weird”
Reviews.Author: timoguic
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for a business trip in Singapore. The hotel is a 10-storey building, with fancy colors on the outside. It is strangely laid off - you have to take 2 elevators to get to your room. Power outlets are very scarce in the rooms (and none in the bathroom). Everything in the room is controlled via a panel with buttons - which was not working properly when I walked in my room (but the staff fixed it quickly). Good breakfast, with Asian and Western stuff. Free high speed Internet (although behind a strong proxy / firewall). You have to walk 15 minutes to get to the closest SMRT station (the Singapore subway system). The only bad experience is that I have been charged for a beer that I bought outside the hotel (I left the empty bottle in my room). I found that a bit dodgy, but the guy removed it from the bill immediately when I complained.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: weegolo
Reviews.Content: The rooms were the best bit about this hotel - small but tidy, clean, and quite well done. But I was disappointed to find that the rooms come with twin beds as standard, and even if you pay to ugrade to a double you get a small double. Their lift system is truly bizarre - one lift from car park to reception, a different lift from reception to bar/restaurant level, and a third lift to get from the bar up to the rooms. Add stained carpets and an unhelpful car parking system ("just squeeze round the barrier, sir") and it's really not good value for high prices they charge. But the worst bit was the breakfast, which was below hawker stall standards but definitely not priced to match. The coffee was horribly stewed - even my work coffee machines produces better! - to the point it was undrinkable, the cooked food looked unappetising and rubbery, the selection was poor, and I can't believe that in south east asia, with so many delicious, cheap, fresh fruits available all year round, they were serving tinned peaches in syrup. For pity's sake, send someone down to the market instead... On the positive side, the location is pretty good, right on the river at Robertson quay and a short walk down to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay or Riverside point.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff was horrible to begin with...”
Reviews.Author: Colby20
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was horrible to begin with, check in was accompanied with horrible service. I suggest if you are goig as a young couple do not choose this hotel because they despise young adults. I wrote a feedback to the hotel, as I was local they forward my CONFIDENTIAL feedback to many different parties and I know about it. Always claiming that their staff are right, do not stay in this hotel unless you are above 30 or you are rich and influential. This hotel provides the worst service ever and do not accept feedback from angry guests. I suggest for the same price you could go to a much better hotel than this. Better service, better rooms, better location. The hotel Is situated away from the bus stops, you neeed to waste money to take a taxi to and fro. And the swimming pool in the condominiums opposite the hotel looks more appealing than the rectangle pool in the hotel. OVERALL THIS HOTEL IS HORRIBLE DO NOT CHOOSE THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick”
Reviews.Author: Sndedit1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 weeks in January/February. I had a corner room which was nice. It was smallish and the bathroom was quite small. The tub/shower is a little difficult to step in and out of. The furnishings are hip and comfortable enough. I was not impressed with the restaurant. There is a nice bar called M Bar thats connected to the hotel. Its outdoors on the river and has a great staff. The hotel is on Robertson Quay which has lots of restaurants and bars and plenty of expat Euros, Aussies and Americans about. Its not really within walking distance to too much, though Clarke Quay is close enough and has food and shopping. We took cabs just about everywhere. Overall it was a decent stay. Oh yeah-the cantilevered pool was great and worth a dip.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute surprise”
Reviews.Author: oyleO
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here after a late night out in the area, and we were too tired to drive home. As we only needed a bed to crash on, we chose a Gallery room, which is smaller than the usual rooms that we stay in when we travel. But the beds were comfortable (there were some colourful cushions present, but we would have preferred extra pillows), there were bedroom slippers, flat screen television, and a very interesting frosted glass panel instead of a wall separating the shower/toilet from the bedroom. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, despite us stumbling in at 3 in the morning. In fact, I think they were quite patient with us while we decided which room we wanted (to splurge or to be practical). This place doesn’t really fall in to the “budget”, “3-star”, “boutique” or “luxury” categories. But it is nice enough for a different kind of hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Optic 1 Room 633 is strange”
Reviews.Author: SuperOFW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at room 633 ("Optic 1") , which is one of those designer rooms and slightly more expensive than the regular rooms which I normally stay in. The black and white patterns were interesting but a bit distracting if you want to work. But the main thing that I didn't like is the fact that the black and white rug at the entrance looked dirty.... All in all, not my best stay at the Gallery Hotel. http://www.galleryhotel.com.sg/stay_633.php Benj

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for business or leisure travelers”
Reviews.Author: siamtraveler85
Reviews.Content: this review is so long overdue but I had a really great experience at this hotel. The hotel is located in an easily accessible area, close to where I had a conference and easy to get to the shopping areas. The check-in process was a breeze, the staff were friendly and professional. The decor is modern, with splashes of color and art adorning the lobby, elevators and halls. the hotel staff who was showing me to my room made sure to stop at the restaurant floors to show me where i could dine or come for a drink. the room was cozy and simple with all amenities covered. At night time, guests can visit the hotel lounge or chill at a bar downstairs for delicious cocktails and snacks. Although I didn't get a chance to check out all their facilities i consider it a great place for excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hpsing
Reviews.Content: After many emails back and forth, our booking was finally confirmed correctly (we stayed twice in 2 weeks). Check-in was fine and the front desk staff were friendly. The concierge desk staff varied. The younger staff member being friendly and polite every time we passed by or needed to ask a question. The same cannot be said of the others we encountered. The free internet is a plus point and you can use one of several computers at any time. The room was medium sized with good amenities and cheerful decor. For our first stay, the room was on the river side of the hotel (that's not to say we had a river view, as it faces a wall of apartments) which was very quiet. On our second stay we were given a room on the hotel's road side and as a light sleeper, the traffic kept me awake most of the night. At 6am the front desk staff were happy to arrange for a room change later in the day. However on being given the job of moving our luggage a few metres down the hall, the older concierge staff member, was rude in gruffly asking us, "Why you move room, huh?" I explained the first room was noisy, and he grunted as if I was talking nonsense. I was so astounded by his rudeness. Personally, if I stay there again I will make sure I am not in a room in earshot of the road. Apart from that incident, the rest of our stay was uneventful and all the staff we met were friendly and helpful. The location is good with lots of places to eat nearby, and of course the riverside which is a good place to walk and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: optiontony
Reviews.Content: We booked via Laterooms an Executive double room (31m.sq) with breakfast. We did not consider the room to be an executive room as it did not come up to the standard of previous executive rooms we have been used to in the Far East. There was only one chair and that was an office type chair and the bathroom was the smallest that we have ever encounted. This was not as clean as we would have expected. The hotel’s website does not appear to list its rooms in the conventional manner so it can be difficult to know exactly what you are booking. The room we stayed in was classified as “a bookend club room”? Arriving for breakfast we were advised that breakfast was not included, but this was sorted. In the local area along the riverfront were a good choice of restaurants and bars. Overall the hotel was OK but not really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: habbalite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week sometime in 2005-2006. it was amazing, the pool is like 4 floors up and glass on 3 sides, best view ever

Reviews.Title: “contemporary”
Reviews.Author: sagarforex
Reviews.Content: I went to singaore with my family for a vacation. The hotel was very differently built and had a conemporary look to it. Rooms were very comfortable. Washrooms and rooms had different interiors with silver metallic look to it. The room no's were not written on the door or on the side. To ur surprise they were written at the base of the door where the foot mat is placed. It was difficult to locate them, but smart idea as well. The food was amazing and so was the exteriors. Reception had very less sitting and the sitting outside reception was also very scenic. There is a colorful bridge with ballon structures on it over a river. The hotel was perfect for me and my family and we remember it even after so long.

Reviews.Title: “Dainty Little Hotel with its own charm”
Reviews.Author: ABChan
Reviews.Content: I think too many people reviewed this hotel negatively due to the size of the room. Sometimes you wonder why you would want a gigantic room for two, especially if the room is meant not more than the day's rest or spending intimate time together. This hotel room is not big, but designers did a good job to utilise the space accordingly. The room is cosy, offers a good night's rest, very clean and is a little brilliantly 'unorthodox' in its decor. I had a wonderful stay. If you are look at the 5 stars splashes in hotels, do not check this one out. But for a nice stay, in cute dainty rooms under an affordable budget, this hotel has that to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Totally not the room I saw on the website or had in mind..”
Reviews.Author: i_love_getaways
Reviews.Content: Last year, my partner and I spent New Year's Eve at Gallery hotel. We stayed in the standard room, and found it cosy albeit a little small. This year, we thought to celebrate the New Year with a stay in the Glazzhauz room, as we saw the pictures on the hotel’s website and thought it interesting. We were sorely disappointed. The room we got was not what was shown on the hotel’s website. The Glazzhauz room we got looks exactly like the standard room and was way smaller! The room was clean and cosy, the service was okay, but I guess I won't be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - not near MRT”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. Very cute, and lovely crips rooms with nice colours. Modern. WIFI was fast and free. Gotta love that! Bathrooms very small but adequate enough. Breakfast buffet v. good for such a small area. My husband judges a breakfast buffet if it has chocolate waffles (as he never has them at home) and no chocolate waffles ha ha. Great location for lots of restaurants (all fairly expensive) .Supermarket about 15 minute walk away. We arrived and pool out of order which was damn annoying as you need a pool in Singapore. This was one of the reasons we booked it as well so rather frustrating. The Hotel is not near the MRT at all and I wouldn't stay here again because of this. A bit too far out of the way for us but otherwise okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 night stay-over after some low-budget travelling in Malaysia”
Reviews.Author: italo12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Glazzhouse-Style-Room, king-size bed, room was big enough for a 3-head-family Very stylish and nice fitted Breakfeast was so nice that we "lost" daily 1 hour of our program as we stayed much too long to taste everything. View was great, also from the pool Little far to walk to next MRT (Clarke Quay or China Town), but taxis where regulary just outside the hotel. Only negative thing was that we waited for our luggaged 10 minutes to arrive in the room which was little annoying as we where already late to meet friends for dinner...

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing, no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: stottyswife
Reviews.Content: As a lone female traveller, I was disappointed with my stay. After a 14 hour overnight flight from the UK my room was not ready on my arrival at 07-30am. I was asked to wait in the restaurant, no complimentry tea or coffee was offered. I found my room to be comfortable, and very clean, the staff were quite friendly. The location of this hotel is quite scary, especially after dark. The reception area is quite small and bleak and there is not enough individual seating. I had a two night stay booked for my return journey, but cancelled this and took a direct flight instead.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at The Gallery Hotel again next time”
Reviews.Content: The Gallery Hotel is awesome!!!! Ultra modern and very trendy, and arty too!!! The entrance/foyer is rather small in comparison to many other hotels, but that's no big deal. It's still nice and clean, and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful (both on reception, and the concierge desk too)! The rooms are of a standard size, but very clean, new, and trendy looking. And the glass doors on the bathrooms are very trendy too. Not an overly exciting view from a standard room, but that's to be expected. The view of the clean, arty room was enough for me!! All the basics are provided, shavng kit, toothbrush & toothpaste, soaps, shampoo's etc... to a very high standard. Now here's where the good part kicks in...... the breakfast!!!!!!! What can I say?! Extraordinary..... very, VERY tasty breakfast buffet. Among the best I've EVER had. A wide selection of usual foods, eggs (cooked specially to your liking), sausages (the BEST chicken sausages I have EVER tasted), a large variety of different types of breads (wholemeal, white, multi grain, rolls, croissants, etc....), hash browns, baked beans.... etc... you name it, they had it! And everything was delicious too!!! Then there were the fresh fruits, cereals, juices, pastries, noodles, yoghurts.... etc.... EVERYTHING!! And it was all of a 5 star standard, along with the exceptional service!!!! Yes, I know... I did go on about the food..... but it was sensational!!! I will definitely be returning to this hotel on my next visit to Singapore... if not only for the food!!! Yum Yum!!! And what's unique..... the pool. It's kind of hanging over the side of the hotel, and has a glass bottom and sides. So you can see down to the street through the pool!!! It's awesome, and extremely unique!!! Well worth the visit!!!! There is also another lounge type eating area for during the day, and a restaurant located downstairs too (outside), along with an outdoor type bar, patio area which is great at night.... and also it's own nightclub!! Liquid!!! What else?? It's situated right on the river.... so it's a lovely view outside!! Along with some nice gardens around the back too!!! Oh yeah... and free internet access in the lounge too!!! This hotel comes highly recommended from me, and I will be staying there on my next visit!! Very happy!!! It may not be in Orchard Road district for shopping.... but within walking distance to the trendy night spot of Clarke Quay!!! Usually went out for dinner there, and walked back to the hotel!!!! The Gallery Hotel is excellent!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A 3 stars hotel at most”
Reviews.Author: vyam
Reviews.Content: NOT A HIP HOTEL -- I choose this hotel because it says it's a hip hotel. Then I found out that not more than 20 rooms in the hotel were decorated in "hip" style. Like mine, the room had no design at all (see attached pics). The only "hip" feel I could find at the hotel was the outlook of the hotel wall and their swimming pool. WRONG RESERVATION -- I booked this hotel thru internet and requested 1 king size bed, non-smoking room. But upon our arrival, they could only offer me a 2 single size beds room. Their excuse was I because I booked thru internet and I needed to call in advance to secure a King size bed with them. They asked if I'm willing to pay S$50 more to upgrade my room to a king size bed room. I felt that I GOT CHEATED, so I didn't accept their offer and kept my 2 single size beds, non-smoking room, which the living room & bathroom was so tiny just like those semi double rooms in Tokyo. DAMP BEDDING -- The bedding was damp I guess because the room was too small, the bathroom and living room was packed together, plus the ventilation system was not working well that when I get a shower, the steam would come out from the bathroom glass door gap (a big gap) and would make the whole room so humid. WEAK WIFI SIGNAL -- I believe they got wifi in the hotel, but the signal was very weak that I got disconneted serveral times within a few minutes. Luckily, their normal wired internet connection worked very well. SERVING MINI SIZE COMPLIMENTRY WATER – You can find 2 bottles of 310ml water in the room, I could finish drinking the whole mini bottle in a second. Can they be more generous in serving normal size 500ml water?! Of course I can always ask for more bottles, but it’s so troublesome to have to call house keeping 2 times in a nite for water. GOOD LOCATION – It’s located right next to Robertson Quay and it’s only 10 mins walk to Clarke Quay. It’s so convenient to get to those bars and clubs along riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WomenTravelClub
Reviews.Content: Its kind of a chic hotel in Singapore, fully utilising the available space as space is a constraint in Singapore. Rooms are very small and there's hadrly any lobby area. Once can enjoy a breakfast with street views around the hotel. Offlate due to rise in Dollar value, hotels in Singapore have become expensive so one can check the price of the hotel before booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Prententious”
Reviews.Author: Scotsmaninmalaysia
Reviews.Content: The Gallery markets itself as a "boutique" hotel. I suppose if lots of glass and metal on the outside and zany architectural stuff meets that criteria, then it is. Gallery room small, but clean and comfortable. More bits of metal on the ceiling to support the wardrobe door, and industrial looking wash hand basin. Two stage elevator a bit of a pain - first one take you to 4th floor where "trendy" restaurant is. Then 2nd one takes you to room levels - but they both seemed to be permanently parked on 10th floor, never 4th. Dont waste your money S$23++ on breakfast. Its been out since 7am and tries to be all things to all races. A freshly fried egg and a few rashers of good bacon with some meat on would have been better. Brewed/stewed coffee a bit grim. Better to go down to the river and pay $10 for breakfast in one of the many cafs. I've stayed here before - think its time to move on. The most annoying thing about Singapore in general is the ++ tax on everything. Same as Malaysia. Yes we know we have to pay service charge/govt tax/ sales tax or whatever. We do everywhere in the world. But why not just make the price what you see is what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Pool!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoysToTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents and brother - two seperate rooms - both comfortable and modern. This hotel is in a good location - close to restaurants and the marina area - a short cab ride from orchard road shopping area. Relatively quiet area but close to everything. This is a great hotel looking for something different - a very strange but funky hotel design, nice bright colours and modern designs. Everyone (parents and brother were happy) The pool is amazing - roof top with spectacular views and glass edge that overhangs the building - very cool! Nothing i can really moan about - breakfast was good - but ate out for dinner/lunch while we were exploring the city. Had internet station near reception and all that we needed. I would definately return I really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charleyquant
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed a few times at the Gallery when in Sinagpore on business. It's website is great and makes it sound like a really funky place when in reality it's actually a hotel with not much vibe but bright coloured walls. Main gripes I've had were when checking in at 2am being told there was no room for me despite my colleague on the same confirmed booking checking in 2 minutes before me. Not the best thing to do to a single girl in the middle of the night - had to really fight to get a room which they eventually did. The rooms are Ok, good tv's wardrobe, wifi etc but they are very noisy with noise from the corridor and alarm calls in other rooms keeping us awake. If you want something basic but slightly cool go for the gallery for it's convenience of the quays.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: causeway00000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a local Singaporean friend (who's in the hotel business). The room was modern and simple, with the lighting skewed a bit to the dim side. The bathroom, although designed exquistely with marble/granite walls, also had these see-through doors which proved to be a bit uncomfortable (for the lack of privacy). The rooftop pool was amazing though! Would recommend for young travelers looking for a good value stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaKwok
Reviews.Content: Short version: Good location, excellent service, great rooms and good facilities. Overall a very good hotel. It is a bit business like but it it in the business district (Robertson quay). Rooms: Very clean, well kitted and generally quite nice. The only downer is the design of the ensuite which is a bit tight. Not too big a deal for me. Very good decor all round. When we were there, someone was having a wedding. Facilities: Pool, Gym, Nice breakfast area, free internet and a free shuttle to a few key locations. Location: On Robertson Quay, it's not too bad. Fairly good for families and business travellers. Nice and quiet as opposed to being on Orchard road. The only downer is if you're vegetarian since there's not a lot of options but it's not a big deal. The other problem with the location is that it's about a 10 minute walk to the nearest MRT (Clark Quay) however the hotel has a free shuttle that'll take you to a few key locations. Staff: The staff were excellent. I've had a late flight so they extended my check out time and after I checked out, looked after my bags and provided access to their change rooms when I came back. Decor: Very good. Very modern and the cafe has an interesting design for tables. It was a bit of a maze to get to the gym it's not a big deal. Overall, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but quite business like”
Reviews.Author: KR_Lawsons
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a designed feel to it, and was very minimal in appearance. The staff at the hotel were friendly and our room had great facilities and a view of the river. Location wise this hotel is also good for walking around Singapore. However as we were on the first leg of our honeymoon, I would say that this hotel had rather a sterile feel to it. Not very relaxing and rather formal.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad service was so bad”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller68
Reviews.Content: I liked staying at the Gallery Hotel because it's located in a nice area of Singapore (within walking distance to one of my company's partner's office) and the internet is free. The rooms are almost kind of modern, or at least they probably were when they first opened. But this last stay at the Gallery Hotel really soured my experience and I don't think I'll ever stay there again. When I checked in I didn't get the room type I wanted. I requested a non-smoking queen/king bed through Agoda and they were out of them when I checked in. I asked them if they could upgrade me to the next sized room with one bed, and they said they'd check. But when they found out that I had booked my room through an online service they said "sorry, no." They did offer to upgrade me with $60++ SGD more per night which I declined. I really didn't know that booking through an online service would mean that would be less motivated to keep a loyal customer happy. Anyway, the stay was fairly uneventful until I got stuck in one of the elevators. The elevator had not worked for over an hour (it wouldn't open on the 5th floor) but there was no sign for it warning guests. When I took the elevator up it got stuck and I had to call for help. They admitted that it wasn't working but only for the 5th floor. So they asked me to go up to the 6th floor and then walk down the stairs. I was really shocked that they would keep an elevator operating knowing that it wasn't working and with no warning to guests. In fact, the engineers didn't even tell the manager (he didn't know) until I made a fuss. I think sometimes you get a sign to not stay somewhere anymore, and the elevator incident was my sign. I hope that the management at the Gallery changes because it's too good of a hotel to be performing so poorly. It's really too bad because the housekeeping staff is excellent and very helpful, but they have these kinks that shows inflexibility and lack of concern for guest welfare, which so damages the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding, but probably unique and definitely nice”
Reviews.Author: kauerman
Reviews.Content: Saying it first, I do like the Gallery Hotel. We've stayed there three times now, always on a stopover from/to Europe to/from Australia. The hotel is somewhat different to the typical main brands, It is within walking distance to the Chinatown and other interesting things, but not in the center of it. The service in the hotel is somewhat improvable which doesn't mean it's bad, but it's not good enough to be outstanding. The rooms are somewhat small, and probably not everyones style. The bathroom has a blinded glass wall, which is somewhat strange but fancy at the same time. The pool is grandious, on top of the roof just over the street. Overall, the Gallery hotel is a nice place to stay and an experience for itself, Just try it. We'll come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good exterior, common room”
Reviews.Author: meowcsj
Reviews.Content: No wow factor except the exterior design. Interior is normal. Don't like their room service as they came knocking on the door to check on mini bar at 10am! I am still in bed! Stay in an excecutive club. Nothing special. The breakfast is normal. The location has not much place to roam about. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: agy
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel whilst travelling home from Indonesia. I was told I had been upgraded beacause there were no non-smoking rooms available for me - whilst I appreciated this, flattery would get this hotel everywhere! Tell people they've been upgraded because they are special!!!! The location of the hotel was fine for a night, but it is not near public transport, so not a great place for trying to travel around Singapore, as taxis are notoriously hard to find. The room was comfortable, with twin beds, wide screen tv, mini bar, bath robes, slippers, toiletries, etc. The hotel markets itself as 'stylish', with rooms interior designed by award winning designers. From the pictures in the brochure, I was perhaps fortunate not to be in one of these! Breakfast was very ordinary - buffet style combination of local and American. Overall, fine for an overnight stay, but I wouldn't want to stay here for a holiday or honeymooon, etc.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: ah_jing
Reviews.Content: chk in was pretty long... with like 8 staff at the counter... 3 staff servicing one chk in pax.... very unproductive. not greeted by smiles. staff seem unhappy at work. requested for comp upgrade, but didnt manage to get it. gallery room, ok, clean, but disappointed no bathtub. with the rate, im expecting at least the bathtub. overall hotel is clean... but not that chic. 9 staff out of 10 come in contact seems bored abt their job. breakfast = abf, noting to shout abt. very basic. but edible. chk out in a mess. same, 8 staff at the counter. i was queueing and the staff actually did not see me and attended to someone who came later than me. it was in a total mess. here and there. not productive. no smiles. unhappy. staff are mainly foreigners, cheap labor, thus poor service? to sum it, not worth paying to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay design hotel does not quite hit the mark”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night en route from Australia to Europe in July 2008. We got a good rate through the SIA Singapore Stopover program, but I do think the usual advertisted rates for the hotel are a little high for what you get. This is very much a hotel populated by "young and beautiful" guests. The room was of minimalist design, very small but perfectly comfortable, and the small bathroom had been laid out very well. The bed was comfortable. The overall design of the hotel reminded me very much of the Adelphi in Melbourne - right down to the glass-edged rooftop pool cantilevered over the street - but it comes off as a slightly pale imitation of that hotel. There is an awkwardness to the design: for example, you have to catch two elevators to get from the ground floor reception to the guest rooms. There are a number of bars and nightclubs located in the hotel, but my sleep was not at all disturbed by any noise whatsoever - the room was completely quiet. The hotel is also just a short walk along the river from the popular Clarke Quay dining and nightlife area (Singapore's main nightlife area for "the young people", according to the taxi driver who took me to the nearby Asian Civilizations Musuem) and many other riverfront dining options on both sides of the river. We enjoyed drinks and tapas at the hotel's riverfront EM Bar in the evening, where you can watch the joggers puff past you and enjoy very reasonably priced happy hour drinks in a relaxed garden setting. In fact, this was the only relaxed part of the hotel - and the most enjoyable. A downside is that the hotel is quite a walk from the nearest MRT station, although taxis in Singapore are of course quite cheap and there are always several outside the hotel. In summary, it is an okay hotel but I think they are trying a little too hard for the "artistic ambience" that it claims to have. Worth trying once if you can get a good online deal.

Reviews.Title: “So what?”
Reviews.Author: madhot
Reviews.Content: Needed a weekend away so decided to spend it at the Gallery as i have dined @ Zenden (for dinner) before. Check in was horrible. Trainee was doing my check in and two senior staff were chatting in the corner. Room was glazzhouse..felt like a very basic accomodation. Tiny room with wannabe cool touches. Bathroom is mosaic and steel.. very cool. Thank god for the QUEEN bed (not king).. Breakfast was horrible. Yucky, basic, and dont be surprised if the staff dont acknowledge ur presence. Check out- the dude undercharged us by about three dollars and then he had to charge again.. Hassle. His mind seemed to be a millon miles away. Bellman SMILES from his desk and continues to read something while i try to locate a taxi. Only reason why i wld stay here- cheap compared to the other hotels in Sg.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of service”
Reviews.Author: dominik_r
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this Hotel a couple of times and found the Hotel and the service received pretty much alright. As usual the rate was right, breakfast a little boring and not much to choose from, but free internet, a relaxed atmosphere and a good location as it is always nice for me to go for a walk by the river. The style is different indeed, but not hip! Nevertheless on my recent stay there was a total lack of service offered by the front office staff. Tried to Check In but they lost my reservation and ask to charge my credit card with the rack rate besides it was prepaid! I denied and pushed them to solve the problem. It took them 1 hour to solve their mistake until I got my key card. They never excused! As prices went up and there are many more options in Singapore I will never stay at this Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: bbixby
Reviews.Content: The Gallery is neither unique nor redeeming through the "extras" it seems to promise. The design is generic steel-and-glass, indistinguishable as uniquely Singaporean in any way. The staff seemed to carry a holier-than-thou attitude for the duration of our three day stay, and we were nickel and dimed endlessly for our charges. Laundering a shirt or pair of socks at the hotel costs about 3 SGD per article of clothing. Ridiculous. When I checked in, I was told three nights stay was 618 USD including tax. When I checked out, I noticed the amount was higher. I was charged 24 SGD for each room service over three days. Extra charge for basic room service? Ridiculous. Our beds were made and little more. Our bathrobes were not laundered or replaced, and since the hotel is perpetually humid (our sheets always felt slightly wet), they grew mildewy after a short period. Please avoid the entire Clarke Quay area if you are visiting Singapore. It is a trap for clueless tourists who are too scared to venture out of their familiarity zone, and hotels like Gallery help foster this ugly attitude even more.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Trying Desperately to be Chic and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: Whether or not you'll like the Gallery depends on what motivates you to love a hotel. I appreciated the free internet and inclusion of breakfast in my room rate. But the rest of the hotel left me rather uninspired. The Room In their attempt to be hyper-architecturally cool they're missing basics. The closet doors are on ceiling tracks so that they 'float'. Nice looking. But they don't slide far enough to actually allow access to the drawers inside! The Bathroom: The heavy glass swinging bathroom door, which again looks very cool, is hinged only to open inwards rather than swinging in both directions. This means that when you want to get out of the bathroom, you have to back against the basin to do it. And to flush the toilet you need all the strength of either your back/feet or shoulders/arm as the wall-mounted button is too low for hand pushing and too high for foot pushing unless you kick. And you need to hold it in for quite a few seconds to get the desired effect. What a palaver. Nice toiletries... The Bed: AWFUL. I stayed in a standard room and the queen sized bed was harder than the worst rock-hard Asian beds I've experienced in my many travels. Thank god there were lots of pillows to try and soften the blow, but I did not get a comfortable night's sleep, which made my day at the office and flight out the next night quite tough. The Logistics: As other reviewers have mentioned, the two-lift system is a huge pain. Dragging luggage in and out of two lifts to check in-out is a huge nuisance, and there are not enough lifts to service the number of rooms at key times, so you wait forever at each juncture. The Food: The room service menu is very limited, so plan on going out for lunch and dinner. Breakfast is fine, and was included in room rate. The Staff: Staff are not particularly polite - too hip to provide any real service, I guess - but you should have little cause to call on them as the hotel is pretty self-explanatory. The Spa: I can highly recommend the Ayuthaya Thai Spa at the hotel - decent value and fantastic Thai massage/spa treatments. i had a 2.25 hour package that included a back/shoulder/neck massage, thai foot massage and facial for SGD188. Of those, I'd recommend you stick to the Thai Massage and don't bother with the rest - the massage was superb. The rest was a bit pro-forma and lacking in care. All in all, I'll definitely come back to the Spa next time I'm in Singapore, but I probably won't bother actually staying at the Gallery Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: ChilliCat16
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Singapore at the beginning of our honeymoon, and our travel agent recommended that we take the Singapore Airlines stopover package, and we picked the Gallery from the brochure of hotels we were given to select from. We picked the Gallery because it looked a bit different from your average hotel - both on the outside and in terms of some of the theme rooms (which weren't part of our package). When we arrived, we found it to be a nice enough hotel, but really, nothing special. We were warned by our travel agent that a double bed wasn't guaranteed, and that we might have to have twin beds - but we didn't anticipate that there would be no possible way of pushing the beds together, as they were attached to the bedhead, and with a bedside table in between - nice start to the honeymoon! We asked if we could move to a room that had a double bed since it was our honeymoon, but were not lucky enough to be upgraded like other lucky reviewers - we could only move on payment of an extra $75 per night. To be fair to the hotel, this was their policy, and it was really our travel agent who should have told us that there was NO possibility of a double bed!! There was nothing really wrong about the Gallery, but really, if you're in the cheaper rooms like we were, you're just in another hotel. It was great being near the Clark Quay area, an area I hadn't visited before.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelnow08
