Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to Glazzhaus room. Great views. Window seat, Queen bed, excellent bathroom. nice amenties. very quiet, super clean. great staff, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Odd coloured Theme Room”
Reviews.Author: Papi_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has different theme rooms. Unfortunately mine was painted all BLACK and had glitter thrown over this, maybe to emulate Space?? Well I didn't quite get this..well the good thing about this hotel is that it is very close to Clarke Key...you can walk there in about 15 mins and also it is 10 mins away from Chinatown as well so for location you can't really fault it. The Staff here are very friendly and I would advise if you are in a hurry to get the staff to order a taxi for you rather than wait...you could be waiting a long long time! The food here is actually good as well so give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Mordern hotel”
Reviews.Author: meeke59
Reviews.Content: Travel agent select this hotel, and found it nice. Good location eg not right in the city area, and close to eateries. The rooms were nice but the bathroom was a bit on the small size, but still ok. The hotel is very modern style, with the pool being up on the 8th floor (Ithink it was 8) Food was great, as well as most of the staff. The internet access is very user friendly. Taxis were readily accessable. All in all, I would probably stay here again

Reviews.Title: “gallery hotel to the rescue”
Reviews.Author: nantendo
Reviews.Content: My trip to singapore was quite a surprise, i had 2 days to plan it and so of course hotels i called were all booked. The Gallery Hotel was my first choice due to their website and at that time had no rooms available, so as adventurous as i usually i'm not, i figured since i was traveling alone i should just wing it and see what'll happen. so i was leaving from Bangkok that afternoon and called them one last time for a chance there was a cancellation and there was!, a deluxe room for about $180 including breakfast for only 2 nights, that's a bit steep for me but i figured i can splurge then find a cheap place for the last 2, staying for 4 nights. I arrived late and was given a smoking room eventhough i requested a nonsmoking but the receptionist called the hotel cleaning person to freshen up the room and i found it to not smell at all. the room was a great size with great design. it was stylish but still extremely functional. i did find it to be a bit damp but overall very comfortable. the breakfast was lovely and filling with a wide variety. the pool was also quite uniqe. Free internet! Well needless to say all of Singapore was booked i was not able to find another hotel and asked the Gallery Hotel's receptionist to please let me know if there's a cancellation and the morning of my check out day, i was told i can remain in my room for the last 2 nights for the same price. so i was saved from a possible nightmare of not having a place or staying at a seedy one. so thanks Gallery Hotel and your helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overated and Over Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Recent_Visitor_7
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 day stay in Gallery Hotel in Singapore and would rate it as an experience to be avoided at all cost.It is a poor ,faded imitation of a quality hotel with smoke smelly floors and obvious attempts to be architecturally sharp without the core requirements of adequate space, good fittings and the usual services you expect from a complete hotel ( is everything outsourced in this hotel??). On top of this they run some stupid chit system for breakfasts so that the outsourced kitchen makes a living and the customer still pays as if it is a proper hotel.Weird and very unpleasant ;like the owner has his hand in your pocket the whole time. We had 2 very tiny rooms for 3 days with 2 breakfasts and 1 initial evening meal that cost in total S$3,300. Don't use this place!

Reviews.Title: “Vision not shared”
Reviews.Author: ehberlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and were glad it was no more than that. Whatever they write about inspiration and visions in their leaflet, we defiinitely did not share theirs. We had a glazzhouse room (652) which was in desparate need of renovation and the carpet should have been exchanged! Can only share the opinion of previous reviewers, this hotel is not hip and needs a make-over. Could not understand the idea behind integrating a control panel in the headrest of the bed which was hidden behind pilllows. Total lack of user-friendliness. Also, the need to change lifts on the 4th level is unnerving. As noted before, there are building sites around the hotel, but this can happen anywhere along the quays. Once this end of the quays has been finished, the location might be more attractive, now it's not close to anything that a visitor might want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Natusik
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the Lonely Planet review which listed it in the Top range hotels section. Part of my disappointment came from this - it is not by any means a Top range. But for the price you pay (about GBP65 per night) it seems to be a good enough value for Singapore. Now facts on the table. The hotel is not very spacious, lobby has a reception desk, taxi desk and two benches and that's it. Club dancing music is played there at any time of day. You have to change lifts to get your room, 2 lifts bring you up to the restaurant level (over-air-conditioned - I felt like putting a jacket on every time I transferred from one lift to the other), and 2 other lifts on the other side of the hall take you up to the rooms. The corridor leading to the room was like an industrial building's one - feels like being in a factory (oldish decoration is partly to blame). The room was cramped (we had a Glasshauz room), barely enough space to go around the queen bed. Musty smell that some other people also mentioned. Aircon was too strong even though we put it to +25, so both of us woke up next day with throat pain. Towels seemed to be sitting in the room for a long time as they also had the same smell, which was gone once they were changed the next day, but wiping yourself with hte first set felt pretty disgusting. Also, they left lots of small fibres on your skin, and being a contact lens wearer I suffered some issues with that! Bathroom was OK but quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern with trendy bars”
Reviews.Author: lambo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gallery Hotel in December 2005, having spent a week with family in Singapore. We chose it because we wanted a boutique style hotel without all the grandeur of some of the international chains. The hotel is definitely cool with relaxing chill out music in the lounge/restaurant area and the swimming pool, although small was interesting with its clear walls overhanging the building (not for the vertiginous). We found the rooms to be ok if a bit small, clean, but perhaps they could have been a bit more plush for the price being paid. They were nothing special - the corridors in the hotel were in need of a coat of paint too as you could see marks on the walls. Breakfast was not very impressive, you are better off going to the food stalls in town for some of the cheap local fare. A plus definitely had to the be the cool bars in the hotel, which attract a younger crowd. One opens out on to the river side and is a good place for a drink away from all the touristy places like boat quay. Having said that, there are several watering holes around the corner from the hotel if you fancy a change of scenery. Overall, it was ok if you are looking for somewhere a bit quirky to stay in Singapore, but don't expect 4* comforts!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: kateb1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Singapore as we were ending a 2 week trip through Thailand. The most prevailing memory was the intense musty/mold smell in the elevator and our room. We had to leave the aircon on as we went out for the day just to air things out. Additionally, the bathroom was very small and it was difficult to get in and out of the shower (and we're in our 20s so it wasn't us being unstable). The location is nice - we enjoyed the bakery across the street for brunch and walked down to Clarke Quay for shopping and a drink. If we're in Singapore again we'd choose one of the many other hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “An Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saranghae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on 2 -6 Jan 2007 at Gallery Room. This hotel have an unique building including the room decoration. The room and bathroom are very clean, comfortable and spacious. The staffs are friendly and helpfull. The corridor along way to the room is also nice and bright. Just one thing, I didn't like the bed because the bed has wheel...so the bed is liitle bit noisy and unstable. If you sit on the edge, the top of the bed will moving up.

Reviews.Title: “Arty but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LeeCSingapore
Reviews.Content: This is the last hotel I stayed in during my most recent trip to Singapore. Although it is very arty if you like that type of thing it is far from comfortable. As in a previous review the beds are rock hard and you may as well sleep on the floor. The steel girders passing trhough the room are also quite bizarre. The was no desk so not great if you need to get some work done. Also if like me you want to go and put your feet up in the bar and have a beer or two then you will be dissapointed as they have tiny plastic stools for you to pirch on. Food in the restaurant was OK. It is ideal to walk down the river to Clarke Quay and dine out in the open air but if I were you I owuld stay on the opposite side of the river in the Copthorne Waterfront

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel that has lost its sheen”
Reviews.Author: darkscot
Reviews.Content: My normal hotel was full due to the IMF conference so I found the Gallery on Expedia. It looked interesting and was in a part of singapore I have never stayed in before. Though once you are there it looks like it is a stage set or themed area in a big theme park. Getting there from the airport took over 40 minutes by taxi. The decor is very minimalist with lots of stone, marble, steel etc. To get to your room you have to take one lift to the fourth floor (where the resturant is) and then get another to the bedrom floor. On opening the bedroom door the first thing that struck me was the ingrained dirt around the keycard holder inside the room. The bedroom door also needed a good clean. The room was very stuffy and smelled musty, as did the corridors. I got the impression the carpets have never been cleaned. The room has a central control panel for the aircon, ligts, tv etc. This was not working and i had to call reception who sent up an engineer who took about 30 minutes to arrive. This later malfunctioned again at 1am and started switching the TV off and on at random. Also the aircon went off and I couldnt switch off the bedside lights. After a call to reception they sent someone up who couldn't fix it so offered to call out an engineer but i insisted they get me another room, which they did. I was on a business trip and so had reports to write. The rooms have free broadband connection which is a very nice and rare feature. I only wanted a sandwich to eat so i went to their cafe. They said their kitchen closed at 6pm but they could get me something from the upstairs resturant if I wanted. I said I would just go up their myself. I had to wait about five minutes to be seated as the only waitress was on the phone. The menu is a bit sparse and unimaginative but the tenderloin I had was very good. I only ate in the resturant on one of the three nights as there were private functions on Fri & Sat. Overall the hotel is ok if you like that sort of thing, I have stayed in a lot worse but there are better hotels in Singapore for the same or not much more money. Very young and inexperienced staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value option for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: HKPhilE
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 10 nights and grew to love its simplicity. Modern European-style design touches and a quiet location next to the river but in easy walking distance of many bars and restaurants - e.g. at Clarke Quay. Free broadband in all rooms (wired, not wireless). Stayed in all 3 basic types of room and there's not much between them except size of the bed - all are compact but well thought out and clean. Room service menu and restaurant/ bar area are fine and reasonable value for a hotel - but of course you can do much better dining out of the hotel. Highly recommended if you're on a medium budget (internet rates start around 158++ SGD) and good for the busiess traveller. Not near Orchard Road but cabs are plentiful and cheap. Will definitely return - business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Does it really inspire?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and although we booked a double room we were given a twin. We were informed we had to upgrade if we wanted a double (which we reluctantly did). What was more annoying was that the room was smaller even though it was advertised as being larger. For two people we really struggled with the limited space (not enough storage for cloths). To top it off the staff were really unhelpful, and suggested that as it is a boutique hotel, room size doesn't count. If the staff seemed interested in you we would have been happier, but no one here was willing to do anything out of the ordinary to help. Secondly, the room was in need a decorating. The shower curtain was mouldy, the carpet stained (incidentally the twin room we were orginially offered had a awful musty smell - this too was a reason for upgrading). The electrics (lights/aircon) were unpredictable. Would I stay hear again? Most certainly not. There are far better hotels in the city. Would I recommend this hotel? No! On a plus side, the bed was confortable, and the conceirge very helpful. Their logo is "The hotel that inspires". Unfortunately they have a long way to go to achieve this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Relaxing Room, Beautiful Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little off the path but was a wonderful place to stay. Located in the Quey (pronounce K) it was about a 10 minute walk from the night lifes of the other Queys and the Clark Quey train station. The people at the front desk were very accomidating to all my needs from needing a plug for my computer, watching my bags for the day after checking out, and requesting a cab to make it back to leave. The use of the internet for free was a great feature, expecially being aboard a ship and not having access. The mattress on the beds were very firm, but very comfortable. Best item I thought was that the controls for everything were places in the head rest of the bed so you could control the lights, AC, alarm clock right were you spend your time usually at the hotel. The bathroom was a beautiful black marble flooring, which once they have slippers and a robe in the room you don't have to worry about it being cold in the morning. The morning breakfast was ok, but being free you can't complain. The pool was also very beautiful being raised above the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip...? if you stay in an Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: cocojones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Hip Hotel guide, and deserves to be. We stayed in an executive suite (very big with bedroom and lounge), which was lovely. Must stress that it does have an "Ikea" feel to it. The facilities were very good... lots of bars, internet access, next to the river (15 mins walk to Clarke Quay). Room service was a little hit and miss. Great, good value, hotel near to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Style Over Substance”
Reviews.Author: gh0z
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gallery for two nights in Nov. 2005. The hotel is situated along the river at Robertson Quay, a pleasant ten minute walk from the Clarke Quay development or a ten minute taxi ride to the shopping area on Orchard Road. Our stay started poorly. Having arrived in Singapore on a late-evening flight from Hong Kong, we arrived at the hotel around 1 AM and were informed that our non-smoking “Bookend Club” room, booked through the hotel’s web site and confirmed with a credit card, was not available. Fortunately, a lovely smoking room was available. So then what was it that was guaranteed? Oh, just the room, not the non-smoking bit. Hmm, it didn’t mention that in the confirmation email, and their web site lists “non-smoking” as an option when you book. Apparently that means at their option. One whiff of the smoking floor had us upgrading to whatever available non-smoking room they had, which turned out to be an Observatory Suite. Our suite was a pretty big room on the corner of the building looking southwest over the river, and though visually interesting was very cold. Not cold as in lacking visual/emotional appeal, but literally cold as in 19 C (66 F) despite setting the thermostat to 30 C and setting the fan speed to minimum (there’s no way to turn it off completely). Their fix the next day brought the temperature up to a balmy 21 C (70 F). The desk kindly informed me on check-out that yes, the air conditioning was too strong and that it was probably due to the weather, and that other rooms also had problems with their air conditioning, some being too hot, others being too cold. Right, and I won’t be paying because my credit card is maxed out, I’m unemployed and I don’t have any cash. At least that’s what I should have said. The hotel and rooms are attractively designed, but other problems crept up in our room. One non-opening window wasn’t well sealed and allowed lots of traffic noise in. The glass bathroom was annoyingly small, especially when there was plenty of room to spare in the Observatory Suite. The attractive tub didn’t work well as a shower stall being raised above the floor level and curved at the bottom. On the upside, the included in-room internet service worked perfectly, and the breakfast buffet was varied and tasty. The pool looked pretty nice. Staff was friendly enough, if a bit young and giggly at times. The front desk staff appears to be well practiced at deflecting complaints and giving excuses. We probably wouldn’t have felt so ripped had we gotten our original Bookend room at SG$168, but at SG$238 for the Observatory, this was a pretty bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Gallery hotel this Fri and Sat. The breakfast and swimming pool were very good. Overall, I think this hotel offers great values. I thought the FREE internet connections at the business was very good. I will probably stay there again. I did have some problems with my room. First of all, there were no sign at all for the bathroom's light. I had to call the frontdesk to ask. Amazingly, no one answered the phone. There was water dripping inside the elavator. The bathroom on the ground floor was a mass. wet toliet paper on the floor, the sink was leaking. They also hire lots of rookies at the reception. They were very slow when I checked out. The location is cleary bad. You need to walk for a long time to get to the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “A hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Owlyo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern especially the glass sided swimming pool which never got busy. The hotel has a few eating places and I found the food to be excellent. A pleasant 10 minute walk from the hotel brings you to Clarke Quay which is full of restaurants/bars and where the nearest MRT station is located. The hotel staff were very helpful whenever I needed their assistance. The hotel could do with abit of a repaint but this did not spoil my stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: cpapakon
Reviews.Content: I did stay one night at the gallery hotel in Sept 2005. The hotel is good. Definetely not the best hotel in singapore. The design is definitely nice and the room interior is interesting. It is not an expensive hotel and the quality of the materials is not top. But architecturaly it is a very interesting hotel. The hotel is old though and not as clean as one would expect. There was dust in the bathroom and furniture (unacceptable to me). Service was very good. i did not have breakfast so I can not comment on that. I believe a better maintenance and cleaning would make it much much better. I was lucky enough to get wifi connection from different sources probably around the hotel. A week later I did stay at the Carlton Hotel and I could say that it was much better/cleaner and the location was better. But I also did pay 15 USD more.

Reviews.Title: “Can have a try”
Reviews.Author: ana526
Reviews.Content: To be frank, my stay in Gallery Hotel is fine. The hotel is bit away from the MRT station. To give you all a rough idea on how far it would be from the MRT station, if by walking, it would take approximately 20 minutes. However, during these 20 minutes, you would get a nice view on the riverside and walk pass the famous clarke quay. And if by taxi, it would take approximately SGD4.50 to go from the hotel to Orchard Road and SGD2.50 from the hotel to Suntec City. If someone is travelling in small group (2 persons), I would suggest to take the airport shuttle when you arrive Singapore. It would cost you SGD7 per head and it is a door-to-door service. But if you are travelling in three or more, better take the taxi. The hotel itself is neat and hip. If you want to try something called boutique hotel. Try this.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we had hoped”
Reviews.Author: leanne_pearc
Reviews.Content: This hotel initially looked good, was modern, popular with the singaporeans and had all that a young crowd would enjoy however during our stay it did not live up to our expectations. We paid for the higher end of room and for what we paid for the room was tiny! everything in the room was smaller in size - could not fit two people in the bathroom, the cupboard could not fit our one standard sized suitcase. The room was worn and same with the hallways. Normally what a hotel lacks it makes up with in other areas but we didnt see this during our stay and unfortunatley would not stay here again. The hotel lacked service and when we needed things we often had to ask twice! There was no room directory and after asking we never got one. Alot has gone into the modern building design - so much that in order to get to our rooms we had to take two lifts every time. The pool was very nice however funnily enough sticking with the modern design the deck chairs were uncomfortable. There is also a pool bar. Breakfast was nice and a great variety. Location was great, being right on the river. Taxi's were always nereby to catch at the hotel. Although their isnt an mrt this did not bother us. At night we would walk to clarke quay - only 10 mins whihc was great. there are lots of building of new bars etc nearby and it looks like the area will be fairly trendy soon. I always hate reading the bad reviews but i have tried to think yes i had a great stay but it was only okay. This hotel has some much potential and with the right management and refurbishment of the worn down rooms and hallways it would make such a difference. overall we paid a little bit more than normally you would in singapore and did not feel we received our monies worth.
